meanings.definition: The plural form of hosel, which refers to the socket in a golf club head where the shaft is attached.
meanings.sent1: Golfers need to check the hosels of their clubs for any damage.
meanings.sent2: The hosels of the golf clubs were carefully inspected before the tournament.
meanings.sent3: When the golf ball accidentally hit the hosels, it made a funny sound.
meanings.sent4: The hosels of the golf clubs were like tiny homes for the shafts.
meanings.sent5: The shiny hosels gleamed in the sunlight, inviting players to tee off.

meanings.definition: The third person singular form of hosel, which refers to the act of attaching a shaft to a golf club head.
meanings.sent1: He hosels the club with precision before each swing.
meanings.sent2: She carefully hosels the shaft to the club head for optimal performance.
meanings.sent3: The way he hosels the club always makes his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her skillful hoseling of the shaft showed years of practice.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, he hosels the club, ready to tee off.

meanings.definition: The plural form of hosel, which refers to the part of a golf club head where the shaft is inserted.
meanings.sent1: The hosels of the clubs were all designed for maximum efficiency.
meanings.sent2: Players need to align the shafts properly with the hosels for accurate shots.
meanings.sent3: The golfer accidentally dropped all the hosels into the bag, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: The hosels acted as anchors, keeping the shafts securely in place.
meanings.sent5: The colorful hosels added a touch of style to the golf clubs.
